required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Absorption, Metabolism, and Route of Elimination of a Novel Class of Anti-HIV 1 Drugs (BMS-955176) in Humans.
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics and Metabolism of [14C] BMS-955176 in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the pharmacokinetics (PK), metabolism, routes and extent of elimination, safety and tolerability of a single oral dose of [14C] BMS-955176 in healthy male subjects. There is no formal research hypothesis to be statistically tested for this study.

primary_outcome.measure: To asses the PK (AUC, Cmax) of a single oral dose
primary_outcome.description: Serial blood samples for PK parameters determined from plasma concentration versus time

primary_outcome.measure: To estimate extent of elimination of a single oral dose (% TRA recovery)
primary_outcome.description: Sample of urinary/fecal/bile will be collected for determining total recovery.

secondary_outcome.description: Safety assessments based on review of adverse events, vital sign measurements, electrocardiograms, physical examinations, and clinical laboratory tests.

arm_group.description: A single 180 mg oral dose of [14C] BMS-955176 containing approximately 80 microcurie of total radioactivity.
A single dose of [14C] BMS 955176 on Day 1 with ND placement 1 hour post dose to facilitate continuous bile collection though 8 hours post dose.

intervention.description: Single dose of drug on Day 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy Male subjects
- Ages 18-50 years
- Body weight of at least 110 lbs (50kg)
- BMI of 18 to 32 kg/m^2
- non-smoking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant diagnostic or therapeutic radiation exposure within the previous 12 months (eg serial X-ray or CAT scans, barium meals).
- gastrointestinal disease including gastrointestinal surgery
- constipation or irregular bowel movements
